The claim was flagged as part of Faceboo: s efforts to combat false news and misinformation on its News Feed.
The girl: s photo used in the claim appeared on a Brazilian website in 2017, where it was asking for blood donations, not money for a kidney transplant.
Similar claims have been debunked in the: such as the claim that Facebook would donate a dollar for every share of a photograph of a sick boy.
The fact: checking organizations Snopes and PolitiFact have rated the claim as false and labeled it as "Pants on Fire."
